posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Recently I noticed that there are very few dedicated stunners on the ECB. In NWN EE Stunning Fist has been nerfed so that it only lasts for 1 round rather than 3 rounds but it is still an incredibly powerful feat. This nerf limits chain stunning and consequently relegates many stunners to support roles, but it is possible to make decent dedicated stunners in NWN EE.

All of the DC numbers in this post assume +12 WIS from buffs, subtract 6 from all DCs for the naked DCs.

The seven builds in this thread are minmaxed for high DCs, they are not designed to be playable in their current forms. They are mainly meant to inspire other stunner builds, feel free to edit them or use the concepts in your own stunners. I might post playable variants in the level 40 section at some point but these particular versions are not good enough to be posted there. For inexperienced builders who are not sure how to make these builds playable, in general you should decrease starting DEX/WIS, improve the AB by increasing DEX and adding AB feats, and lower the DC by dropping WIS and ISF feats. 20 WIS and ISF10 results in a 61 DC Stunning Fist at level 40, this is usually the DC I aim for when making stunners. Since these are just rough builds to showcase stunners I haven't made full skill progressions for any of them.

The seven builds below are:
Monk20/CoT10/Figh10 - Maximum DC Stunner (23x 69 DC)
Druid20/CoT10/Figh10 - Maximum DC Dragon Stunner (13x 68 DC)
Monk6/Cler26/Figh8 - Battle Cleric Stunner (9x 67 DC)
Monk20/Pal4/Figh16 - Divine Might Stunner (23x 66 DC)
Dru24/Monk6/Figh10 - Generic Dragon Stunner (9x 66 DC)
Monk21/Figh14/SD5 - Generic Stunner (24x 64 DC)
Rog13/Monk21/Figh6 - Crippling Stunner (24x 62 DC)

===

Below is a list of 51+ DC stunner builds in the archives and forum:

Bard20/CoT18/Wiz2 by Ithacan (10x 59 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 66683.html]
A support stunner with Curse Song and Lasting Inspiration, although it needs some tweaking I actually like the concept.

Dru12/Shif22/Figh6 by WhiZard (10x 66 DC). [draco-stunner-druid-12-shifter-22-fight ... 28975.html]
A high DC stunner with both Dragon Shape and Undead Shape, it could be improved by adding more Fighter levels.

Monk10/Ass26/Figh4 by Dralik Galley (13x 54 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 24443.html]
This build combines Death Attack and Stunning Fist, unfortunately it is much less impressve in NWN EE due to nerfs.

Monk14/Wiz5/AA21 by Dralik Galley (14x 52 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 38543.html]
A decent ranged AB combined with Stunning Fist for opponents in melee range, it needs some tweaking but it's another interesting stunner concept.

Monk20/Figh10/CoT10 by Hediyoshi (20x 61 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 23970.html]
A playable stunner, the AB is a bit low but overall it's a fairly standard build.

Monk20/Figh20 by Burylene (23x 60 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 60419.html]
I prefer Monk21/Figh14/SD5 since it can get Epic Dodge, but other than that it's another standard build.

Rog17/CoT22/SD1 by Ithacan (13x 61 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 72092.html]
A Rogue stunner with Epic Dodge and high saves, the AB is a bit low but overall it's a decent build.

Rog19/Figh20/SD1 by grizzled_dwarflord (13x 51 DC). [https://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/bui ... 21720.html]
A Rogue stunner with Crippling Strike and Epic Dodge, it has decent AB for a stunner but it needs some changes to make it legal in 1.69/EE.

Monk20/CoT10/Figh10 - 23x 69 DC Stunning Fist

This build has the maximum Stunning Fist DC possible in vanilla NWN. CoT10 gives access to Divine Wrath with +5 AB and +5 unblockable divine damage, however even with +12 CHA this is limited to a 5 round duration. Since Stunning Fist only works if your attack actually damages your opponent, this unblockable damage can be used to stun opponents that would otherwise be immune due to high DI/DR.

In order to make this playable, lower the starting stats to 18DEX/16WIS in order to increase the other abilities. Increase BAB to 16 by changing the pre-epic level spread and focus on DEX rather than WIS in order to improve AB. Finally, take weapon feats such as EWF: Unarmed and EWS: Unarmed to improve the build's offensive capabilities.

Dru20/CoT10/Figh10 - 13x 68 DC Stunning Fist

This build has the maximum Stunning Fist DC a dragon can achieve in vanilla NWN. Dragon Shape is a great fit for Stunning Fist since all dragon builds naturally have a high WIS score. They also don't suffer from the poor AB or damage most stunners have since they get a high STR score when shifted. This build gets Dragon Shape at level 30, it's not possible to move it any earlier and still reach the maximum DC.

Personally I wouldn't bother trying to make this build playable, if you want a dragon stunner make a Dru/Monk/Figh. It gets a better attack progression and better AC, the only downside is less room for ISF feats.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Monk6/Cler26/Figh8 - 9x 67 DC Stunning Fist

Battle clerics make for great stunners due to Cleric buffs alleviating the AB issues most stunners have. Even caster clerics can be decent stunners due to their AB buffs and high WIS. The damage from Battletide and Divine Favor bypasses DI/DR so there's no need to worry about high DI/DR blocking the stun attempt. This build has only 6 base Stunning Fist attempts per day because it has 6 Monk levels, Extra Stunning Attacks increases this to 9 per day. It would actually have more Stunning Fist attempts if it had no Monk levels, since it would have 10 base attempts per day from being level 40.

In order to make this playable, I recommend increasing the Monk levels to at least 10. A Monk10/Cler26/Figh4 can still reach a decent DC even if it is built with EWS: Unarmed and a lower WIS. Lower starting DEX and WIS in order to boost the other abilities, particularly INT due to the low number of skill points. Even when fully buffed the unarmed damage is pretty low compared to kama damage, it might be worth focusing on both unarmed strike and kamas.

Monk20/Pal4/Figh16 - 23x 66 DC Stunning Fist

This build works best in environments where abilities are fairly easy to cap, almost every ability is important. Divine Might bypasses DI/DR and so stunning attempts can't be blocked by high DI/DR. This build can achieve a fairly high AC and decent saves, but even a playable version will have low AB.

In order to make this playable, I would increase CHA to 18 and pick up Divine Shield. Not only does this increase the damage but it improves the defences of the build. If you want Divine Might, Divine Shield, and Extra Turning then change the level layout to Monk21/Pal5/Figh14. Even with high DEX, higher CHA, and EWS: Unarmed this build can still achieve a decent Stunning Fist DC.

Rog13/Monk21/Figh6 - 24x 62 DC Stunning Fist

This build combines Stunning Fist with Crippling Strike and +7d6 Sneak Attack in order to damage stunned opponents. High AC, Epic Dodge, speed, stealth, and UMD are the main defences, you will need to use kiting and corner sneaking against tough opponents. This is one of the most flexible (and annoying) stunners since it can potentially use traps and UMD in addition to Crippling Strike and Stunning Fist.

In order to make this playable, lower the DC in order to improve AB and damage. Increasing the BAB to 16 gives +1 AB and +1 APR but it means moving 3 epic feats to pre-epic levels, it might be better to stick with a pre-epic spread of Rog4/Monk16.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I don't mean to be down on this, but the nerf really just killed stunners.

You get 1 round.  Whoopee.  It's like KD, but...bleh.  KD I can spam all day.  Stunning Fist has a limitation.

I play monks, and yeah, I used to use stunning fist all the time.  But after the nerf...it's basically useless (especially where I play).

If one is in a party, and has some major backup, it is not bad.  Or one has some massive crit/sneak damage that one can pile on after the stun (especially if one has lots of attacks).  But other than that, it is a limited version of KD.

That is how I see it now.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
It's true that most of the stunners I've made are PvP builds. The ECB mainly focuses on PvM builds but I was still surprised that there are hardly any stunners posted online. Resisting a 60 DC Stunning Fist is usually harder than resisting a KD attempt from a +60 AB build, especially since Discipline gear is fairly common on PvP servers. Even with +20 fortitude most builds will still struggle to reliably resist a 60+ DC Stunning Fist so it can be useful even in high magic PvP environments.

Regarding spoilers, in the past I have tried to use tapatalk features such as spoilers and URL linking but they didn't work properly. I'm certain that the BBCode is correct but it still doesn't work reliably for me, so now I just ignore those features most of the time. I haven't had this problem with BBCode on any of the other online forums I use, just tapatalk.
